section.title: Common and Misc Libraries
section.paragraph: Libraries common throughout manila or just ones that havenâ€™t yet been categorized in depth.

section.title: The manila.context Module
section.paragraph: RequestContext: context for requests that persist through all of manila.

desc_content.paragraph: Represents the user taking a given action within the system.
Return a version of this context with admin flag set.

section.title: The manila.exception Module
section.paragraph: Includes decorator for re-raising Manila-type exceptions.

desc_signature.desc_annotation: = 'Admin port IP for service instance not found: %(reason)s'
= 'No default share type is configured. Either configure a default share type or explicitly specify a share type.'
= 'HNAS SSC Context has been changed unexpectedly: %(msg)s'

= 'Unable to create lock. Coordination backend not started.'
= 'Manage existing share failed due to share type mismatch: %(reason)s'
= 'Manage existing share failed due to invalid share: %(reason)s'
= 'Manage existing share snapshot failed due to invalid share snapshot: %(reason)s.'

desc_content.paragraph: To correctly use this class, inherit from it and define a â€˜messageâ€™ property. That message will get printfâ€™d with the keyword arguments provided to the constructor.

section.title: The manila.test Module
section.paragraph: Base classes for our unit tests.
Allows overriding of flags for use of fakes, and some black magic for inline callbacks.

desc_content.paragraph: Test case base class for all unit tests.
Assert a list of dicts are equivalent.
This is a â€˜deepâ€™ match in the sense that it handles nested dictionaries appropriately.

block_quote.paragraph: If you donâ€™t care (or donâ€™t know) a given value, you can specify the string DONTCARE as the value. This will cause that dict-item to be skipped.

desc_content.paragraph: Python < v2.7 compatibility. Assert â€˜aâ€™ in â€˜bâ€™.
Python < v2.7 compatibility. Assert â€˜aâ€™ NOT in â€˜bâ€™.
Assert a sub_dict is subset of super_dict.
Override flag variables for a test.
Use python mock to mock a class
Mocks the specified objects attribute with the given value. Automatically performs â€˜addCleanupâ€™ for the mock.
Use python mock to mock an object attribute
Mocks the specified objects attribute with the given value. Automatically performs â€˜addCleanupâ€™ for the mock.
Run before each test method to initialize test environment.
Runs after each test method to tear down test environment.
We inherit from str in case itâ€™s called with json.dumps.
We inherit from str in case itâ€™s called with json.dumps.
A pluggable backend loaded lazily based on some value.
A simple eventlet pool to hold ssh connections.
Return an item from the pool, when one is available.
This may cause the calling greenthread to block. Check if a connection is active before returning it. For dead connections create and return a new connection.
Close an ssh client and remove it from free_items.
Validates if keys in params are boolean.

list_item.paragraph: keys â€“ List of keys to check
params â€“ Parameters received from REST API
default â€“ default value when it does not exist

field_body.paragraph: a dictionary with keys and respective retrieved value

desc_content.paragraph: Validates if keys exist in params.

list_item.paragraph: keys â€“ List of keys to check
params â€“ Parameters received from REST API

desc_content.paragraph: Convert bytes and Unicode strings to native strings:

list_item.paragraph: convert to bytes on Python 2: encode Unicode using encodeutils.safe_encode()
convert to Unicode on Python 3: decode bytes from UTF-8

desc_content.paragraph: Convenience wrapper around osloâ€™s execute() function.
see built-in open() documentation for more details

definition_list_item.term: Note: The reason this is kept in a separate module is to easily

definition.paragraph: be able to provide a stub module that doesnâ€™t alter system state at all (for unit tests)

desc_content.paragraph: Parse bool value from request params.
HTTPBadRequest will be directly raised either of the cases below: 1. invalid bool string was found by key(with strict on). 2. key not found while default value is invalid(with strict on).
Calls decorated method only if notifications are enabled.
Check if eventlet support IPv6 addresses.

If the Flags.monkey_patch set as True, this function patches a decorator for all functions in specified modules. You can set decorators for each modules using CONF.monkey_patch_modules. The format is â€œModule path:Decorator functionâ€. Example: â€˜manila.api.ec2.cloud:â€™ manila.openstack.common.notifier.api.notify_decoratorâ€™
Parameters of the decorator is as follows. (See manila.openstack.common.notifier.api.notify_decorator)
name - name of the function function - object of the function
Check if oslo notifications are enabled.
This decorator allows to log and to check â€˜retriesâ€™ input param. Time interval between retries is calculated in the following way: interval * backoff_rate ^ previous_attempt_number

list_item.paragraph: exception â€“ expected exception type. When wrapped function raises an exception of this type, the function execution is retried.
interval â€“ param â€˜intervalâ€™ is used to calculate time interval between retries: interval * backoff_rate ^ previous_attempt_number
retries â€“ number of retries. Use 0 for an infinite retry loop.
backoff_rate â€“ param â€˜backoff_rateâ€™ is used to calculate time interval between retries: interval * backoff_rate ^ previous_attempt_number
wait_random â€“ boolean value to enable retry with random wait timer.
backoff_sleep_max â€“ Maximum number of seconds for the calculated backoff sleep. Use None if no maximum is needed.

desc_content.paragraph: Check whether a service is up based on last heartbeat.
Translates human-readable storage size to float value.

definition_list_item.term: Supported values for â€˜multiplierâ€™ are following:

list_item.paragraph: float if correct input data provided

desc_content.paragraph: Convenience wrapper around osloâ€™s trycmd() function.
Walk class hierarchy, yielding most derived classes first.
